p: These advantages are caused by the interaction between crops and the change of microbial activity in the crop rhizosphere ( Zhang et al., 2015). Studies have shown that intercropping can affect soil microbial community structure, diversity, and functional diversity ( Li et al., 2009; Wortman et al., 2013; Zhou et al., 2014). For example, Wheat intercropping Brassica changed the rhizosphere microbial community structure of wheat ( Wang D. et al., 2007). Similarly, the PLFA method also confirmed that intercropping can affect the rhizosphere microbial community structure of maize and legumes ( Li et al., 2009). Rice and watermelon intercropping improved the diversity of watermelon rhizosphere soil microbial communities, which ultimately reduce the disease index of watermelon fusarium wilt ( Ren et al., 2008).
